adjectives.description: microscopic (comparative more microscopic, superlative most microscopic)

entries.meaning: Of, or relating to microscopes or microscopy; microscopal
examples: We supply all microscopic stains and other materials.

entries.meaning: So small that it can only be seen using a microscope.
examples: The water was full of microscopic organisms.
Compared to the galaxy, we are microscopic in scale.

entries.meaning: (figurative) Carried out with great attention to detail.
examples: The police carried out a microscopic search of the crime scene.

entries.meaning: Able to see extremely minute objects.
